title: How to get content idea to write fashion blog - Quora

response.answer_text: When you’re just starting out as a fashion blogger you probably have tons of ideas for posts. If you’ve been at it for a while, however, coming up with a unique take on a trend or a fresh angle for an outfit post can be more challenging.  I feel your pain, I’ve been there :) Luckily, inspiration is all around. Fashion is such a generous niche, offering plenty of opportunities for bloggers looking to stand out from the crowd. With a little imagination, you could write an entire essay about an accessory alone – how it helped you at one time in your life, how you came to have it, the outfit it best goes with, and so on. If you’re having trouble building a post, use the 6-word formula - Who, What, When, Where, How, Why. As long as you have these basics covered, you can end up with a gorgeously-crafted post with minimum effort. Bookmark it for days when you’re low on creativity.  Or, for extra help, rely on clichés you can make your own. Here are some evergreen content ideas that can come in handy for anyone running a fashion blog: Gift Guides – suitable for every occasion, from Christmas to Valentine’s Day to birthdays;Red Carpet or Celebrity Roundups – cataloging looks that you find inspiring;Wardrobe Essentials – what are those must-have pieces everyone should own?Closet Declutter – are there any clothes or accessories you donated/gave away recently? Why? Do you plan to do so in the near future?The Best Looks for Every Season – this can be a fun outfit post with choices for spring/summer/fall/winter;Back to School Looks – what wardrobe items would you recommend for someone who is going back to school?Designers to Watch – a list of promising designers you started following recently;What’s in My Bag? – pretty self-explanatory, this kind of post will never go out of style;DIY Projects – maybe you’re into designing your own clothes? Or found a way to transform a basic outfit into something completely new?Trends to Follow – a list of trends everyone should pay attention to for the coming year or season;Shopping Tips – where do you like to shop and why? Where can your readers find the best sales?Fashion Haul – what items of clothing or accessories have you bought recently?Wishlist – are there any accessories or clothes that you’re saving up for? Why?Style Icons – talk about a style icon and highlight what makes them special in your eyes;Educational Posts – is there anything you’re fascinated about and would like to share more with your readers? Maybe you can write about how a certain designer rose to fame, how make-up evolved throughout the years, how to tell if a vintage piece is really worth the money, and so on;Outfits for Every Occasion – What to wear on the first date? What to wear at the gym? What to wear when going to the opera? You get the idea.How to Pack for Vacation – What’s in your suitcase when you go away for a few days? How do you decide which pieces to take and which to leave behind?Outfits on a Budget – challenge yourself to build a memorable outfit for only $100, or $50, or even less;Capsule Wardrobe – Could you make do with a capsule wardrobe? What are the items your capsule wardrobe would include?How to Style Articles – How can you style cargo pants for every occasion? Or Chelsea boots?General “How to” Posts – How to find your signature style? How to find a swimsuit that actually looks good on you? How to stop overspending on clothes?Apartment/Room Décor Tips – let your readers learn more about your décor preferences;Look Inspired By – create a look inspired by a TV character, actor, show, book, etc;Behind-the-Scenes – let readers learn more about how you edit your pics for Instagram, or plan your shoots, or come up with post ideas (!)
